Journal Story: Leaving for Georgia tomorrow. Dan and I will spend a couple of days together before I hit the approach trail Sunday. It seemed like the past 2 years waiting for retirement would never get here but now I can't believe it's time to start this incredible journey!
pack is ready (again) but with 2 more pounds!
Thought I had this all figured out but still wondering if I'm taking enough or too much!
Arrived in Georgia today.
Rainy 8 mi Mon. a lot of great hikers here. We all love rain!
7.7 great miles today.lots of really nice hikers here. 3days down!
Almost 9 miles to lance creek. Beautiful views!
Hiked 7 miles today to blood mountain. Wasn't as hard as was told and the views were great. Staying at neel gap hostel tonight. Had great trail magic here.
11 Miles to Low Gap today in heavy rain. Hopefully no more tonight!
Long tough climb but beautiful views.

Hiked 13 miles to Tray Mountain Saturday and it was a hard climb but beautiful views. Today I arrived in Hiawassee after 11 miles. Staying at Holiday Inn to get a good night sleep but will be on the trail again in the am and hopefully cross into North Carolina. We're supposed to be in for a few days rain. Oh well, had a dry tent for 2 days! The folks I've met in Georgia are really great and helpful to the hikers.
Tented at Bly Gap in the rain after 9 miles. One state down. Now in N.C.!h

7.7 miles in rain.Trails really muddy and flowing with water. Sorry to be missing the beautiful views with all the cloud cover. Met Wheaties on the trail. He and Dan met at Amicalola after I hit the access trail.
Even with rain a good day of miles due to moderate elevation change. Unfortunately still missing the views.

Short miles and only light rain. Shuttle to Franklin appeared as I took my last step off the mountain at Winding Stair Gap! Enjoying the luxury of great food shower and clean clothes. Wonderful trail angel Beverly gave me a ride back to hotel after I bought supplies and did laundry. It had started pouring rain again. The help received along the journey is given so generously!
Left Franklin around 1 after buying a more comfortable pack. Made 8.2 mi and tented at Wine Spring campsite. Rain all day and night. Only one other hiker camped here.
Great hike with no rain but trail is really muddy. Took nice photos from Wayah Bald rock tower.
Another heavy rain day. Left camp at 10:30 and staying at Nantahala to dry out.
Took day off to go to Dr. About swollen knee. Hopefully a day and night of rest will get me back on trail tomorrow. Was disappointed to have to take my first zero day!
Light day to rest knee. Met a new hiker friend Doreen at shelter.

Tented at Cody Gap with lots of familiar hikers. Beautiful but steep hike today. Was kind of scary with high winds and threat of storms after setting up tent. Luckily storm passed with not a lot of rain.
After short miles met up with my original hiker family. We had a great hiking day and enjoyed the rest of the day together.
We decided to take a rest day. Knee still needs to take it easy and another hiker in our group took a fall in all the mud we've had to hike through and he has knee pain also. Pi

Hard climb to Mollies Ridge but cool temp and we beat the rain. Hiked most of the day with on of my friends. Spent my first in shelter night. The hiker next to my bunk snored like a freight train but it may have kept the mice away!

Really tough hike to Rocky Top and Thunderhead 5527'. Weather was windy with cold rain. I'm sure the views would have been great without the cloud cover. The shelter and tent sites were packed. Lots of hiker friends. One of the shelter hikers had a mouse in his pack in the morning.

A beautiful day and hike. The shelter area grassy and I had a nice tent spot. Not very many hikers stayed but a Trail runner was there for the night and he was really nice. It was really cold that night and the frost was so thick on my tent it looked like it snowed when I shook it.

Most beautiful hike yet. Beautiful as I climbed through Balsam Fir forests. The fragrance was incredible as well as the views. Climbing Clingmans Dome was a milestone as the highest point on the AT. Taking a rest in Gatlinburg but trail angel who brought me to town will take me back to the trail tomorrow. Trail Angels are incredible!
Great hike today with beautiful weather and incredible views. Saw a lot of familiar faces on the trail. Many of them pass me but we end up at the same place at the end of the day!
Another great hike with high altitudes most of the day with high at 6417'. Actually had snow/sleet showers but a couple times when the clouds parted I was at the most beautiful overlooks!

Today I completed the Great Smokey Mountains which were the most beautiful and fragrant part of my journey so far. As I came to the end of the trail off the Smokies I saw one of our trail angels and his som who were going to hike for a few days and we took each others photo. A couple miles later I reached Standing Bear which was a totally unique experience. This is a very rustic quaint hostel where I was greeted by the caretaker Lumpy who walked me around the facilities consisting of the shower, restocking store, kitchen, bunkroom and laundry room (washing machine is a tub with a washboard). Since I really wanted to sleep and not listen to snoring, Lumpy let me stay in the "couples room". The bed was made of some kind of discarded iron parts and the room was decorated by spider webs in the corners but the soothing sound of the stream out back and the private patio made it a great experience!

Today was a lot of climbing first from 1800' to 4263' where there were incredible views on top of Snowbird Mountain. Lots of hiker friends taking a break to enjoy the view. Next was famous Max Patch summit, 4629', which is a bald covered in lush grass and has panoramic views of surrounding foothills,mountains and valleys.
This was a long hard day but was anxious to make it to Hot Springs. This is a small town with the AT going straight down the main street. It is famous for it's natural mineral hot springs.

Resting my injured knee with a spa whirlpool and my tired muscles with a massage. Hopefully knee will feel better tomorrow-two long mile days probably were too much. Most of my original trail friends are staying in town too.
Friends convinced me to rest knee another day so I plan on moving on again tomorrow.
On the trail again but knee still bothered me in the am. Climbed from 1326' to 3300'. The first of the trail is along the beautiful French Broad River.

This morning was very painful getting started and my friends went ahead and I figured I'd see them at the end of the day. When I approached Allen Gap they were all there and Kamikaze was wrapping her foot she had just sprained. She was going to have to go back to Hot Springs to the medical center and I decided I had better get medical attention for my knee problem also since it was getting worse each day. I'd already been to a clinic so I'm going home for medical care and tlc and when I'm "fixed" I'll be back to enjoy the rest of this journey of a lifetime.

Had knee surgery 6-24 with expected recovery of 6 weeks. If all goes well I'll return to the trail probably at Harpers Ferry in hopes of making it to Katahdin before Oct 15. I would then go south from Harpers Ferry and pray for a mild winter!
Destination: will return to trail after recovery
